name: OutSystems Generator MCP Server
description: MCP server providing tools to create and deploy OutSystems applications from natural language prompts. Supports real-time streaming progress updates and production-ready deployment on Cloudflare Workers.

tools.name: configureOutSystemsEnvironment
tools.description: Configure OutSystems environment credentials for the current session. Use this if environment variables are not set. The agent will guide you through finding each credential.

hostname.description: OutSystems Developer Cloud hostname (e.g., your-org.outsystems.dev). Find this in your OutSystems portal URL.

username.description: Your OutSystems account email address. This is the email you use to log into OutSystems.

password.description: Your OutSystems account password. This is the password you use to log into OutSystems.

devEnvId.description: Development environment stage ID (UUID format). To find this: 1) Go to https://<your-hostname>/apps, 2) Click any application, 3) Look for 'stageid' parameter in the URL, 4) Copy the UUID value.

tools.name: clearOutSystemsConfiguration
tools.description: Clear the runtime OutSystems configuration. This does not affect environment variables.

tools.name: createOutSystemsApp
tools.description: Creates and deploys a complete OutSystems application from a text prompt. The prompt should describe the desired application in 10-500 characters. Note: If environment variables are not configured, you must first call configureOutSystemsEnvironment to set up your credentials.

prompt.description: A detailed description of the application to create. Must be between 10-500 characters.

url.description: The URL where the deployed application can be accessed

applicationKey.description: The unique identifier for the created application

tools.name: healthCheck
tools.description: Checks if the OutSystems API is accessible and authentication is working properly
